newsitem.title: POLAND: Polfa Kutno sees PLN 19.5 mln net in 1997.
newsitem.headline: Polfa Kutno sees PLN 19.5 mln net in 1997.

text.p: Polish pharmaceutical company Polfa Kutno SA said in a statement on Friday it expected to net 19.5 million zlotys on sales of 239 million zlotys in 1997.
It said it expected its pre-tax profit to reach 30 million zlotys.

The company has not yet published results for the whole of 1996 and after the first 11 months it had made a net profit of 14.1 million zlotys and a pre-tax profit of 22.2 million on sales of 156.9 million zlotys.

Polfa also said it would spend 43 million zlotys this year on its mid-term investment programme aimed at increasing production and achieving the Good Manufacturing Practice (GMP) international quality standard.
Polfa also said it was considering shedding its veterinary products division but so far no decision had been made.

Earlier on Friday the daily Rzeczpospolita said the stock's recent rise might have been triggered by speculation that it was planning to sell its veterinary division and bid for a drug company undergoing privatisation.
But Polfa denied in the statement that it had any plans of investing in Polish pharmaceutical companies offered by the treasury ministry.
